cinder-block-rod.description:
The Cinder Block Rod is a Stage 3 Fishing Rod obtained at The Laboratory for C$50,000.

seems a little heavy...
The Cinder Block Rod is a Stage 3 Fishing Rod with extremely high Luck and Resilience, combined with very high Control and massive Weight. Its negative Lure Speed makes it slow to attract fish, but its other stats make it exceptionally durable and capable of handling the toughest catches.

infoboxStats.passive:
70% chance for Cement (1.5×)
 Always sets Progress Speed to -85% (Hidden)

random-rod.description:
The Random Rod is a Stage 7 Fishing Rod obtained from Daily Shop for a random price between C$1C$-1,000,000C$.

?
The Random Rod is a high-tier rod centered entirely around unpredictability. It features high Luck and decent Lure Speed, but low Resilience, with other stats fluctuating wildly on each cast.

infoboxStats.passive:
50% chance for Jackpot (7.77x)
50% chance for Unlucky (0.5x)
50% chance for caught fish to have double weight, 50% chance for caught fish to have half weight

Each cast randomizes a boost to stats:
• -80% to +80% Resilience
• -0.3 to +0.3 Control
• -77% to +100% Progress Speed

tryhard-rod.description:
The Tryhard Rod is a Fishing Rod previously awarded exclusively to various Official Fisch Content Creators and developers but now publicly available by completing RoRed's questline.

Every cast is a challenge. Every catch, a victory. -RoReddo [Controlled/Herculean Enchant REQUIRED]
The Tryhard Rod is a Stage 10 Fishing Rod with extreme Luck and massive Weight.

infoboxStats.passive:
All fish caught are Tryhard (10×) 
 +300% Progress Speed

blade-of-glorp.description:
The Blade Of Glorp is a Stage 8 Fishing Rod obtainable via a set of quests within Roslit Bay.

A sharp Blade & friendly UFO crafted by Glorp harnesses the power of Lasers. Be careful, it is hot and will melt your hands if touched. [For @uhvanni]
The Blade Of Glorp is a high-tier Fishing Rod with a powerful, high-risk, and high-reward progress affecting ability.

infoboxStats.passive:
23% chance for Gleebous (8×)
Every 2 seconds, there is a 20% chance for a laser to strike after 2 warning pulses
After the laser strikes:
• -66% Control for 0.3 seconds
(Reduces Control to 1/3 of it's current value)
• Sets Progress Gain/Loss rate to 0.25% per frame, decaying over 2.5 seconds
• If the fish has not left the bar during the 0.3 seconds duration, gains +10% Progress

onirifalx.description:
The Onirifalx is a Stage 10 Fishing Rod obtainable via a set of quests within The Depths.

Tempered in dreams and sharpened by peril, the Onirifalx reaps catches with unrivaled speed for those who can hold their ground. [For @animepunk]
The Onirifalx has strong stats in all aspects allowing most fish in the game to be caught in a short amount of time. The Onirifalx features a high progress speed boost that is balanced out by very low resilience, making the player have to either be skilled with moving the bar or take advantage of certain Enchantments to keep the fish in the control bar.

wind-elemental.description:
The Wind Elemental is a Stage 10 Fishing Rod obtained from a set of quests at the Glacial Grotto.

May you slash with all the colors of the wind.
The Wind Elemental is a high-tier Fishing Rod with extremely high Lure Speed and Luck, paired with solid Resilience and low Control. Its stats make it exceptionally efficient at catching high-value and difficult fish, while its infinite Weight allows it to handle the largest catches without limitation.

The Ruinous Oath is a Stage 10 Fishing Rod obtained in Crimson Cavern for C$5,000,000 after Level 750.

Born from radiant crystals scorched by crimson fury, this blade blazes with unbound strength; its power no longer knows restraint...
The Ruinous Oath is a late-game Fishing Rod with very high Luck and substantial Weight, complemented by moderate Lure Speed and low Control. Its stats make it extremely effective for large and valuable catches, though its handling requires some precision.

silly-fun-happy-rod.description:
fishing rod

The Silly Fun Happy Rod is a Stage 4 Fishing Rod obtained from a set of quests at the Underground Music Venue.

:P
[@newandreformedlyth]
The Silly Fun Happy Rod is a Stage 4 fishing rod with extreme, exaggerated stats. It has infinite Lure Speed, very high Luck, and infinite Resilience and Weight, though it also comes with no measurable Control. These stats make it powerful on paper, but its design offsets that advantage through chaotic mechanics.

infoboxStats.passive:
Instantly loses fish when it gets out of the fishing bar
+50% Progress Speed
+50% Forced Progress Speed
50% chance for Honked (2×)

When fishing, one of 5 minigames are guaranteed to happen:
• Spinning Bar: The player's fishing bar will continuously spin.
• Random Movement: The player's fishing bar will erratically move across the screen.
• Fake Catch: The player will get the notification of catching Nessie, these notifications are fake and the player will not receive them.
• Jumpscare: After finishing the minigame, the player will get a jumpscare.
• Bossfight: The player's Control will be set to -0.29.

destiny-rod.description:
The Destiny Rod is a Stage 6 Fishing Rod obtained from Caleia for C$190,000.

The Destiny Rod pulses continuously with the pure essence of luck. (10% Higher chance of Shiny & Sparkling fish)

The Destiny Rod is a direct upgrade to the Fortune Rod, with a high Luck stat of 250. The rod also has a strong 0.

fortune-rod.description:
The Fortune Rod is a Stage 2 Fishing Rod obtained in Roslit Bay for C$11,000.

Extremely lucky rod with an odd tendency to attract significantly rarer fish than usual.

The Kraken Rod is a Stage 7 Fishing Rod obtained in Atlantis for C$950,000 after Level 180.

Crafted from the tentacle of an ancient Kraken, this mysterious rod pulses with dark energy. Gives you a random Legendary/Mythical/Exotic fish every 5 catches. 20% chance of giving you 2x the amount of fish.

Additionally, it has a stab ability similar to Trident Rod and the No-Life Rod, but providing an additional boost equal to 3% of current completion.

Intertwined with souls of the masses; a reminder that we are all human after all.

rod-of-the-exalted-one.description:
The Rod Of The Exalted One is a Stage 6 Fishing Rod obtained by completing the The Keeper's Secret puzzle.

Originally created for the most magnificent royals, was lost in time and sealed away. Exalted Relics now have a 4x higher chance to be caught.

infoboxStats.passive: 4× more likely to catch Exalted Relic

The Scarlet Spincaster Rod is a Stage 6 Fishing Rod obtained from Crimson Cavern for C$180,000

A rod steeped in sanguine essence, pulsing with forbidden vigor and granting a 30% chance for the Crimson mutation
The Scarlet Spincaster Rod is a high-tier rod with moderate Lure Speed and very high Luck, along with slightly negative Control and extremely high Resilience, making it effective for catching heavy and active fish. Its Weight allows it to handle very large catches reliably.

Its passive provides a 30% chance to apply the Crimson mutation, increasing a fish’s value by 4×.

Overall, the Scarlet Spincaster Rod is a powerful rod for players who want to target high-value and heavy fish, combining strong durability with consistent mutation potential.

infoboxStats.passive: 30% chance for Crimson (4×)

poseidon-rod.description:

Blessed by the God of the Seas himself, this trident-inspired rod commands...

volcanic-rod.description:
The Volcanic Rod is a Stage 5 Fishing Rod obtained in Volcanic Vents for C$250,000.

A rod forged in the heart of molten fury, granting a 25% chance for the Ashen Fortune mutation.
The Volcanic Rod is a high-tier rod with moderate Lure Speed and strong Luck, along with solid Control and modest Resilience, making it effective for catching a variety of fish. Its Weight allows it to handle very heavy catches reliably.

infoboxStats.passive: 25% chance for Ashen Fortune (5×)

abyssal-specter-rod.description:
The Abyssal Specter Rod is a Stage 7 Fishing Rod obtained in Atlantis for C$850,000 after reaching Level 170.

Forged in the darkest depths of the ocean's trenches, this spectral rod radiates an otherworldly strength. Its phantom line reaches impossible depths, while its ghostly power grants the ability to haul in catches that would snap lesser rods. All fish are 20% larger, & have a 25% chance to be Abyssal.

infoboxStats.passive:
+20% weight buff to all fish caught 
 25% chance for Abyssal (5.5×)

the-lost-rod.description:
The Lost Rod is a Stage 6 Fishing Rod acquired by Crafting.

After a Perfect Catch, there is a 36% chance for next catch to become Lost.
The Lost Rod is a balanced high-tier rod with moderate Lure Speed and solid Luck, supported by good Control and Resilience. Its Weight capacity allows it to handle a wide range of medium-to-heavy fish reliably, making it useful across many fishing locations.

infoboxStats.passive: 36% chance for Lost (4.5×) after a perfect catch

zeus-rod.description:
The Zeus Rod is a Stage 7 Fishing Rod obtained in Atlantis for C$850,000 after Level 150.

Forged in the heart of Mount Olympus, this divine rod crackles with Zeus's lightning. Its power grants the ability to command storms, with a 90% chance to inflict the Electric Shock mutation on fish; all others are Charred.
The Zeus Rod is a high-tier Fishing Rod focused on chance-based value generation.

kings-rod.description:
The Kings Rod is a Stage 4 Fishing Rod obtained at the Keepers Altar for C$100,000.

All fish caught are 30% bigger.
The Kings Rod is a mid-tier rod with moderate Lure Speed and high Luck, along with solid Control and Resilience, allowing it to handle a wide range of fish reliably. Its Weight is unlimited, making it suitable for catching the heaviest fish without restriction.

infoboxStats.passive: +30% weight buff to all fish caught

voyager-rod.description:
The Voyager Rod is a Stage 5 Fishing Rod acquired by Crafting.

A rod forged by an ancient civilization, capable of mass destruction. All fish have a 35% chance to be fossilized. [Lasers fish with an orbital cannon]
The Voyager Rod is a high-tier rod with moderate Lure Speed and strong Luck, along with low Control and solid Resilience, making it effective for a variety of fish.

infoboxStats.passive:
Laser that fills up 20% progress 
 35% chance for Fossilized (3.3×)

long-rod.description:
Not to be confused with Long, an Enchantment for increasing line distance.

The Long Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained in Moosewood for C$3,000.

Not the strongest, but it’s sure the longest! Is this really needed?

phoenix-rod.description:
The Phoenix Rod is a Stage 3 Fishing Rod obtained in Ancient Isles for C$50,000.

Embued with the spirit of the graceful Phoenix. All fish have a 40% chance to be set ablaze.
The Phoenix Rod is a mid-game rod with moderate Lure Speed and high Luck, making it effective for catching rarer fish.

infoboxStats.passive:
40% chance for Scorched (3×)
10% chance for Solarblaze (3×)

wisdom-rod.description:
The Wisdom Rod is a Stage 5 Fishing Rod acquired by Crafting.

A mystical rod that rewards skilled fishers, granting a stackable 5% XP bonus for every perfect catch in a row up to 80%.
The Wisdom Rod is a high-tier rod with moderate Lure Speed and strong Luck, along with slightly negative Control and high Resilience, making it effective for handling active fish. Its Weight allows it to catch moderately heavy fish reliably.

infoboxStats.passive:
+5% XP for every perfect catch streak 
 -10% XP for every perfect catch failed 
 Capping at +80%, cant go below 0%

midas-rod.description:
the fishing rod

The Midas Rod is a Stage 3 Fishing Rod obtained from the Travelling Merchant for C$55,000.

Blessed with the power of Midas. All caught fish will be golden
The Midas Rod has relatively lackluster stats, but has a passive ability for a 100% chance to catch a fish with the Midas Mutation, which doubles their sell value. Its best suited for fishing in areas with easier to catch fish unless enchanted due to its decreased resilience.

infoboxStats.passive: All fish caught are Midas (2.5×)

wildflower-rod.description:
The Wildflower Rod is a Stage 3 Fishing Rod obtained in Terrapin Island for C$40,000.

Entwined with blooming vines and the essence of the wild. Fish drawn to nature will find it hard to resist.

The Wildflower Rod is the one of the cheapest rods with a mutation that can be purchased in the First Sea.

infoboxStats.passive: 30% chance to catch Mother Nature (3× Value)

brick-rod.description:
The Brick Rod is a Stage 4 Fishing Rod obtained by completing an elaborate set of puzzles.

Wait.. it's real?
The Brick Rod has decent Luck, alongside very high Resilience and Control.

infoboxStats.passive: 100% chance for Studded (1.8×)

summit-rod.description:
The Summit Rod is a Stage 5 Fishing Rod obtained in Cryogenic Canal for C$500,000.

A refined rod with snow-white highlights and shimmering blue effects, boosts Progress Speed by 10%. Has a 40% chance for fish to be Frozen, 20% chance for Sleet, & a 15% chance for Blighted.
The Summit Rod is a good mid-game rod.

infoboxStats.passive:
+10% Progress Speed 
 40% chance for Frozen (1.5×) 
 20% chance for Sleet (2.4×) 
 15% chance for Blighted (3×)

nico-s-yarncaster.description:
The Nico's Yarncaster is a Stage 6 Fishing Rod obtained from Crazy Cat Lady.

a kitty who trots by your side and sneakily snags extra fish when you're not looking! [extra power with clownfish cat toy!]
Nico's Yarncaster is a Stage 6 fishing rod that features unique passives.

infoboxStats.passive:
30% chance for Skrunkly (2.5x)
Every 60s while idle, 33% chance for Nico the cat to give a Nico's Nyantics (5x) fish with a size equal to its base weight + minimum weight. 

If Clownfish Cat Toy is equipped:
30% chance for Nico's Nyantics (5x)

nocturnal-rod.description:
The Nocturnal Rod is a Stage 2 Fishing Rod obtained in Vertigo for C$11,000.

Seems to wake up fish just by throwing the bobber in!-- Can catch nocturnal and diurnal fish at any time!
The Nocturnal Rod is an early-game rod with moderate Lure Speed and higher-than-average Luck for its tier.

infoboxStats.passive: Removes time preference Luck penalty

depthseeker-rod.description:
The Depthseeker Rod is a Stage 3 Fishing Rod obtained in Atlantis for C$40,000.

Engineered with deep-sea technology, this resilient rod thrives in challenging conditions.
The Depthseeker Rod is a mid-game rod with moderate Lure Speed and Luck, along with solid Control and Resilience for its tier, allowing it to handle larger and more active fish reliably. Its high Weight lets it catch significantly heavier fish than earlier rods.

infoboxStats.passive: +5% Progress Speed

seasons-rod.description:
The Seasons Rod is a Stage 5 Fishing Rod acquired by Crafting.

Boosts fish luck by 40% for the current season. It also has a 50% chance to grant a "Seasonal" mutation that changes the fish's colors based on the season it was caught. 

Seasonal Mutation Buffs -> Spring: 4.

infoboxStats.passive:
Depending on current Season, receive the following: 
 +40% luck for fish preferring current season 
 50% chance for Seasonal Mutation: 
 Spring: 3.5× Value 
 Summer: +25% Size 
 Autumn: 4× Value 
 Winter: 2.5× Value

avalanche-rod.description:
The Avalanche Rod is a Stage 3 Fishing Rod obtained in Frigid Cavern for C$35,000.

A sleek rod with an icy blue spiral design and glowing blue accents, has a 25% chance for fish to be covered in Sleet.

The Avalanche Rod boasts similar stats when compared to the Depthseeker Rod and can be an alright alternative to it but it is still recommended to purchased the Depthseeker Rod due to it having more Resilience for a slightly higher price.

The rod includes a 25% chance to apply the Sleet Mutation.

infoboxStats.passive: 25% chance for Sleet (2.4×)

reinforced-rod.description:
The Reinforced Rod is a Stage 3 Fishing Rod obtained from the small cave in Desolate Deep for C$20,000.

Crafted by a metal stronger than diamond, making it capable of fishing in any harmful liquid
The Reinforced Rod has unremarkable stats, only notable for its ability to fish in both the Brine Pool and Roslit Volcano. This makes it a necessary purchase for any players determined to explore these hazardous areas and fill their bestiary. It is not advisable to use outside of these areas due to its low stats.

champions-rod.description:
The Champions Rod is a Stage 4 Fishing Rod obtained in Atlantis for C$90,000.

Wielded by legendary tournament winners, this balanced rod embodies competitive excellence.
The Champions Rod offers strong overall stats for its price, and is often recommended for users having difficulty catching higher-rarity fish.

However, due to a lack of any passive to assist in profitability, this rod generally shouldn't be used for optimal C$C$ farming.

aurora-rod.description:
the rod

The Aurora Rod is a unique Stage 4 Fishing Rod obtained in Vertigo for C$70,000 during an Aurora Borealis.

Enhanced by the Aurora Borealis' energy. All fish have a 15% chance to have the Aurora mutation. Chances increase to 30% during Aurora Borealis.

infoboxStats.passive:
15% chance for Aurora (6.5×) 
 30% chance for Aurora during Aurora Borealis

mythical-rod.description:
the Fishing Rod

The Mythical Rod is a Stage 4 Fishing Rod obtained from the Travelling Merchant for C$90,000.

Blessed with the power of The Keepers. All fish have a 30% chance to be rainbow.
The Mythical Rod is a mid-tier rod with moderate Lure Speed and Luck, along with low Control and modest Resilience, making it suitable for handling light to medium fish.

infoboxStats.passive: 30% chance for Mythical (5.5×)

ice-warpers-rod.description:
The Ice Warpers Rod is a Stage 4 Fishing Rod obtained in Frigid Cavern for C$65,000 after completing the Levers Puzzle.

A frost-themed rod with glowing blue accents and icy particle effects. Has a 25% chance to mutate fish with Blighted.

An overall decent rod with high lure speeds and resilience, with a good passive ability to come with this rod.

infoboxStats.passive: 25% chance for Blighted (3×)

resourceful-rod.description:
The Resourceful Rod is a Stage 5 Fishing Rod acquired by Crafting.

Doubles the effects of all bait, and has a 60% chance to not consume bait, increasing the efficiency of every catch.
The Resourceful Rod is a mid-tier rod with low Lure Speed and moderate Luck, along with slightly negative Control and low Resilience, making it less effective for handling active or heavy fish. Its Weight is limited, restricting it to lighter catches.

infoboxStats.passive:
Doubles the effect of all Bait 
 60% chance to not consume Bait

celestial-rod.description:
the fishing rod

The Celestial Rod is a Stage 8 Fishing Rod acquired by Crafting.

After catching 15 fish, summon Celestial powers for 2 minutes, boosting +100% luck, +60% lure speed. Caught fish also get the Celestial mutation & +50% XP on them!
The Celestial Rod is a high-tier Fishing Rod that offers a balanced stat spread with moderate Lure Speed, Luck, and Control, supported by solid Resilience and a high Weight capacity.

infoboxStats.passive:
For 2 minutes after 15 fish are caught:
• +60% Lure Speed
• +100% Luck
• 100% chance for Celestial (4×)
• +50% XP

magma-rod.description:
The Magma Rod is a Stage 2 Fishing Rod obtained by completing Orc's Quest in Roslit Bay.

Hot to the touch. Engulfed with constantly burning passion to fish. [Capable of fishing in lava, 5% chance for fish to become mutated with Ashen Fortune]
The Magma Rod is an early-game rod with moderate Lure Speed and Luck, along with solid Control for its tier, making it easier to maintain progress during catches than most Stage 2 options.

infoboxStats.passive: 35% chance for Ember (3×)

scurvy-rod.description:
The Scurvy Rod is a Stage 3 Fishing Rod obtained in Forsaken Shores for C$40,000.

This rod has been on every pirate ship imaginable. Decent at everything, bad at nothing. Just like a pirate should!

infoboxStats.passive: 15% chance for Greedy (5×)

eidolon-rod.description:
The Eidolon Rod is a Stage 9 Fishing Rod obtained from The Sanctum after Level 350.

A spectral rod infused with phantom energy, hastening progress and drawing forth the Phantom mutation; even completing your catch as reality begins to fade...
The Eidolon Rod is a top-tier Fishing Rod with very high Lure Speed and solid Control, but low Luck and minimal Resilience. Its infinite Weight allows it to handle the largest and most difficult fish without limitation, making it suitable for late-game catches.

infoboxStats.passive:
35% chance for Phantom (4.5×)
 +40% Progress Speed
After reaching 70% Progress:
• Sets Progress Speed to +666%
• Sets Control to 0.7

rapid-rod.description:
The Rapid Rod is a Stage 2 Fishing Rod obtained in Roslit Bay for C$12,000.

Extremely fast rod that catches fish at record speeds! -it even has racing wings!
The Rapid Rod is an early-game rod with high Lure Speed and moderate Luck, making it well-suited for quickly hooking fish.

fungal-rod.description:
The Fungal Rod is a Stage 2 Fishing Rod obtained by completing Agaric's quest in Mushgrove Swamp.

Has a 30% chance for fish to be Fungal, & a 70% chance for the rod to sprout suspicious spores, giving you Luck X for 45 seconds! Prettyy funky!
The Fungal Rod is an early-game rod with modest stats suited for introductory fishing.

infoboxStats.passive:
70% chance to give 45s of +50% Luck after a catch 
 30% chance for Fungal (4×)

arctic-rod.description:
The Arctic Rod is a Stage 3 Fishing Rod obtained in Overgrowth Caves for C$25,000.

A white rod with frost effects and a cool blue glow, all fish become Frozen.
The Arctic Rod is an early game rod with fairly decent stats. However, it is recommended to buy the Depthseeker Rod, as it has vastly superior stats, for a slightly higher price.

infoboxStats.passive: All fish caught are Frozen (1.5×)

crystalized-rod.description:
the fishing rod

The Crystalized Rod is a Stage 3 Fishing Rod obtained in Overgrowth Caves for C$35,000 after completing the Diamond Puzzle.

A luminous rod with a bright yellow glow and crystal-like effects. Has a 20% chance to Crystalize fish.

The Crystalized Rod is a fairly good fishing rod targeted to newer players.

infoboxStats.passive: 20% chance for Crystalized (3.5×)

auric-rod.description:
The Auric Rod is a Stage 6 Fishing Rod obtained from Sunken Chests.

A rod forged with many valuable gemstones. Fish caught with this rod have a random sell value between 2-4x
All fish caught with the Auric Rod are guaranteed to have one of the following mutations, each with an equal chance of 20% being applied:
- Aurous (1.5×)
- Aurelian (2×)
- Aureate (2.

infoboxStats.passive:
All fish caught will be one of following, with an equal 20% chance for each: 
 Aurous (1.5×) 
 Aurelian (2×) 
 Aureate (2.5×) 
 Aurulent (3×) 
 Aureolin (3.5×)

stone-rod.description:
The Stone Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained in Ancient Isle for C$2,000.

A rock-hard rod made purely from stone, which also makes it quite heavy.
The Stone Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod with a focus on control and durability. It offers slightly negative Lure Speed but compensates with high Control and moderate Luck, making it easier to manage fish during the catch.

steady-rod.description:
the fishing rod

The Steady Rod is a Stage 2 Fishing Rod obtained in Roslit Bay for C$7,000.

Insanely stiff and strong. Can withstand immense pressure and tension. - Increases shake UI size.

infoboxStats.passive: Increases shake button size

carbon-rod.description:
The Carbon Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained in Moosewood for C$2,000.

Stiff, strong, and easier to handle than other rods out there, however it is slightly shorter.
The Carbon Rod is a well-rounded Stage 1 Fishing Rod that provides a noticeable upgrade from the early-game options. It offers moderate improvements to Lure Speed and Luck, making it a reliable pick for players who want more consistent catch rates without major drawbacks.

spiritbinder.description:
The Spiritbinder is a Stage 9 Fishing Rod obtained from Crafting.

Spirits occasionally leave fish behind... Their presence subtly draws high-rarity fish closer...
The Spiritbinder is a high-tier Fishing Rod with solid Lure Speed and minimal Control, complemented by moderate Resilience and substantial Weight.

infoboxStats.passive:
25% chance for Spirit (5.2×) 
 5% chance to gain the highest rarity fish from current pool with Spirit Mutation 
 Every 60 seconds gain random fish from current pool with Spirit Mutation

plastic-rod.description:
The Plastic Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained in Moosewood for C$750.

Made of ABS plastic; You can trust this rod will last you.
The Plastic Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod that offers a modest step up from early-game options. With a small increase to Lure Speed and Luck, it provides noticeably faster hook times and a slightly higher chance of catching valuable fish.

fischer-s-rod.description:
The Fischer's Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained from the Starter Pack for 99 Robux.

A fischer's starter rod to get started with Fisching! What else would you do with this?..
The Fischer’s Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained from the Starter Pack.

fast-rod.description:
The Fast Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained in Moosewood for C$4,000.

Quick rod that seems to catch fish in a fly! You can tell it’s fast from the racing stripes.
The Fast Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod built around extremely high Lure Speed, making it one of the quickest early-game rods for getting bites.

flimsy-rod.description:
The Flimsy Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained at the start of the game.

Quite the weak and unreliable rod. But, it can get the job done!
The Flimsy Rod is the starter rod given to every new player upon beginning the game.

magnet-rod.description:
The Magnet Rod is a Stage 2 Fishing Rod obtained on Terrapin Island for C$15,000.

This rod has an advanced magnetic field, allowing it to quickly attract crates and loot.
The Magnet Rod is a unique fishing rod which specialises in collecting Crates rather than fish thanks to its passive effect. Attracting a fish is still possible, but is exceptionally rare.

infoboxStats.passive: Greatly increases chances for catching Crates.

the-boom-ball.description:
The Boom Ball is a Stage 6 Fishing Rod obtained from a hidden sub-location in Desolate Deep.

how could this possibly be a good idea?
The Boom Ball is an unusual rod with no Lure Speed or Luck, but extremely high Control and heavily negative Resilience, giving it very fast movement but almost no stability. Its Weight capacity is extremely high, allowing it to reel in even the absolute heaviest fish without restriction.

infoboxStats.passive: 50% chance for Exploded (0.1×) with +100% Progress Speed

jinglestar-rod.description:
fishing rod
Fischmas2025.png

The Jinglestar Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained from the Fischmas (2025) Advent Calendar during the Fischmas (2025) event.

Only obtainable during Fischmas; A legendary rod of starlight and bells, its full strength will return when real Christmas magic awakens...
The Jinglestar Rod is a fishing rod with extremely high overall stats for progression.

infoboxStats.passive:
25% chance for Jingle Bell (8×)
 +25% Progress Speed
 While fishing, there will be a visible Bell with a ring counter above it:
• The ring counter always starts at 0
• An input from the player will ring the Bell once, increasing the ring counter
• The player must ring the Bell 10 times in a row with the correct timing

If the player succeeds:
• +20% Progress

• The ability goes on a 2 second cooldown
(If the player fails, the ring counter will reset to 0)

christmas-tree-rod.description:
fishing rod
Fischmas2025.png

The Christmas Tree Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained from the Advent Calendar during the Fischmas (2025) event.

Only obtainable during Fischmas; A festively lit tree repurposed as a rod! All fish have a 25% chance to be Merry.

infoboxStats.passive: 25% chance for Merry (5×)

cornucopia-rod.description:
fishing rod
Fischgiving 2025.png

The Cornucopia Rod is a Stage 7 Fishing Rod obtained from completing the Pilgrim questline during the Fischgiving (2025) event.

Only obtainable during Fischgiving: A bountiful horn-of-plenty rod that spills Fischgiving treats onto fish, making them easy pickings!
The Cornucopia Rod is a Stage 7 fishing rod that offers a balanced spread of stats, featuring strong Lure Speed, solid Luck, dependable Control, and high Resilience.

infoboxStats.passive:
10% chance for Gravy (6×)
 Drops a random piece of food on the fish every 2-3s, each giving +10% progress

bat-whisperer-rod.description:
fishing rod
FischFright2025.png

The Bat Whisperer Rod is a Stage 6 Fishing Rod that was purchasable in FischFright 2 for 10,000.

Only obtainable during FischFright; A cursed rod that summons swarms of bats to snatch fish from under the water; their numbers multiplying under unknown conditions…

The Bat Whisperer Rod is a high-end rod that with strong Lure Speed and Luck, with moderate Control and Resilience. Its passive allows the player to catch additional fish at a high frequency with a guaranteed mutation, making it a strong rod for money making.

infoboxStats.passive:
+10% Progress Speed 
 1 Bat is always present 
 +1 Bat during Night 
 +1 Bat for 15 seconds after a catch 
 For each Bat, receive a Batty (2.5×) random fish from the last pool the player fished in every 30 seconds

dusekkar-rod.description:
fishing rod
FischFright2025.png

The Dusekkar Rod is a Stage 7 Fishing Rod that was purchasable in FischFright 2 for 25,000.

Only obtainable during FischFright; Haunted by the fireless spirit of Matt Dusek; this rod is haunted with a spectral blaze...
The Dusekkar Rod is a great all-rounder rod most notable for its great money-making techniques and overall great stats.

infoboxStats.passive:
+25% Progress Speed
20% chance for Nightmare (8.8x)
12% chance per fish movement to stab for +20% progress

jack-o-blazer.description:
fishing rod
FischFright2025.png

The Jack-o-Blazer is a Stage 6 Fishing Rod obtained from doing Headless Horseman's quest line.

Only obtainable during FischFright: A flame-engulfed rod wreathed in Halloween-spirit, launching blazing jack-o-lanterns that explode on impact; incinerating the waters and anything daring to swim within!

The Jack-o-Blazer is overall a fantastic fishing rod that is capable of catching almost all fish in the game with relative ease.

infoboxStats.passive:
+15% Progress Speed
 20% chance for Wicked (6.6x)
 2% chance for Jack's Curse (8.5x)
 Every 1 second Jack-o-Lanterns fall, increasing Progress by +8%

necrotic-rod.description:
fishing rod
FischFright2025.png

The Necrotic Rod is a Stage 8 Fishing Rod acquired by Crafting during FischFright 2.

Only obtainable during FischFright; A rod infused with necrotic energy that saps the life from its prey; reeling in fish as their vitality withers away.
(To be added.

infoboxStats.passive:
+13% Progress Speed 
 30% chance for Necrotic (7.4x) 
 Every 2 seconds whilst reeling a fish: 
• Reduces Control by 10% of its current value
• Increases Progress Speed by 10% of its current value, increased by 100%
• Increases Resilience by 10%

spooky-rod.description:
fishing rod
FischFright2025.png

The Spooky Rod is a Stage 4 Event-exclusive Fishing Rod obtained during FischFright 2025.

(Only obtainable during FischFright; The rod is cursed the constant energy of FischFright, allowing it to catch FischFright mutations all year round.)

0.

infoboxStats.passive:
+5% Progress Speed 
 10% chance for Frightful (6×) 
 10% chance for Spooky (6×) 
 10% chance for Eerie (6×) 
 Every 1 second 50% chance to gain +4% Progress and freeze the fish for 1 second

vinefang-rod.description:
fishing rod

The Vinefang Rod is a Fishing Rod obtained as a reward from the Jungle's Echo Bone Hunt.

Only obtainable during Jungle's Echo Bone Hunt; 
A fragile rod of bone and vine, hiding absurd, untamed power that awakens only in the Jungle.

The Vinefang Rod is Rod Of The Forgotten Fang's weaker, limited-time counterpart. This rod trades its Control and Resilience for a stab ability that differs from the traditional stabs like the Trident Rod's stabs, where instead of relying on fish movement, it rolls a 15% chance every second to unleash a flurry of 3-5 slashes onto the fish, filling 1% of the progress bar per stab and stunning the fish for 1 second.

infoboxStats.passive:
+50% Progress Speed 
 After 2 perfect catches, the next catch will summon a green Megalodon to catch a higher-rarity fish, boosting its weight by 15-20% 
 Every 1 second, 15% chance to unleash 3-5 Slash (0.3s interval) each granting 1% Progress and stunning the fish for 1 second

haunted-rod.description:
FischFrightBackground.png
fishing rod

The Haunted Rod is a Stage 2 Event-exclusive Fishing Rod obtained during FischFright (2024).

Only obtainable during FischFright; The rod is cursed the constant energy of FischFright, allowing it to catch FischFright mutations all year round.

The Haunted Rod is an early game rod previously obtainable during FischFright.

infoboxStats.passive:
10% chance for Sinister (2.9×) 
 10% chance for Ghastly (3×)

relic-rod.description:
fishing rod
ArchaeologicalSiteFar.png

The Relic Rod is a Stage 2 Event-exclusive Fishing Rod obtained for C$8000 after completing the Archaeological Hunt puzzle.

A really old rod, found from the tombs of ancient isles, crafted out of ancient bone, but does it hold a mysterious power within it?

The Relic Rod is not a great fishing rod.

antler-rod.description:
fishing rod
FischmasTree.png

The Antler Rod is a Stage 1 Event-exclusive Fishing Rod obtained from the Advent Calendar during the Fischmas (2024) event.

A rod bearing the magnificent antlers of a reindeer. All fish have a 25% chance to be Jolly.

infoboxStats.passive: 25% chance for Jolly (2.2×)

north-star-rod.description:
fishing rod
FischmasTree.png

The North-Star Rod is a Stage 1 Event-exclusive Fishing Rod obtained from the Advent Calendar during the Fischmas (2024) event.

Powered by the intensely bright shine of the Northern Star
The North-Star Rod is a special, limited-time fishing rod, exclusively available during the Fischmas (2024) event via the Advent calendar on Day 9. This rod is a coveted prize for players looking to enhance their early-game fishing experience, offering a balanced mix of speed, luck, and resilience.

candy-cane-rod.description:
fishing rod
FischmasTree.png

The Candy Cane Rod is a Stage 1 Event-exclusive Fishing Rod obtained in the Winter Village for C$1,500 during the Fischmas (2024) event.

A sweet and minty rod with a festive pattern. All fish have a 10% chance to be Festive.

infoboxStats.passive: 10% chance for Festive (2.4×)

krampus-s-rod.description:
fishing rod
FischmasTree.png

Krampus's Rod is a Stage 5 Event-exclusive Fishing Rod acquired by Crafting during the Fischmas (2024) event.

Haunted with the evil spirit of Krampus himself. Every 10 catches, gain a random temporary buff.

infoboxStats.passive: Every 10 catches, gain Luck V or Lure V for 3 minutes

frost-warden-rod.description:
fishing rod 
fishing rod
FischmasTree.png

The Frost Warden Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained from the Limited Time Winter Bundle for 799 Robux.

A frigid rod weilded by fierce angels. Build to fish in the coldest of waters.

fischmas-rod.description:
fishing rod
fishing rod
FischmasTree.png

The Fischmas Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained from the XMAS Pack for 799 Robux.

A festive fishing rod wrapped in holiday cheer, perfect for reeling in seasonal treasures.
The Fischmas Rod is a special, limited-time fishing rod, exclusively available by buying the XMAS Pack for 799 Robux.

frostfire-rod.description:
fishing rod
fishing rod
FischmasTree.png

The Frostfire Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained from the XMAS Pack (II) for 799 Robux.

 A sleek fishing rod wreathed in flames and frost, designed to tackle the toughest catches with elemental flair.
The Frostfire Rod is a special, limited-time fishing rod, exclusively available by buying the XMAS Pack (II) for 799 Robux.

firework-rod.description:
fishing rod
GoldenTide.png

The Firework Rod is a Stage 2 Event-exclusive Fishing Rod obtained from Dr Glimmerfin's Quest during the Golden Tide event.

A rod imbued with festive magic. 15% chance for Firework Mutation (3.

shamrock-rod.description:
rod

The Nates Blade is a Fishing Rod which was obtainable from the Black Market.

A sword wielded by the one and only Nate The human. Created by Nates father, out of Kee-Oths Blood. [For @Woozynate]
The Nates Blade is a Stage 10 Fishing Rod with high-end stats, offering strong Lure Speed, exceptional Luck, and solid Resilience.

infoboxStats.passive:
Control bar gradually increases in size whilst catching a fish.
+100% weight buff to all fish caught.
100% chance to obtain one of the three mutations:
• Lumpy (2×)
• Rockstar (2×)
• Bubblegum (2×)
All three Mutations have equal chances.
25% chance per fish movement to stab for +6% progress.
+50% Progress Speed.

noctone.description:
fishing rod

The Noctone is a Fishing Rod given to players who originally owned the Axe of Rhoads prior to its removal.

Wherever we end up; Know that you've made your mark...
The Noctone is a Stage 10 fishing rod with a well-rounded stat profile, offering solid Lure Speed, strong Luck, steady Control, and dependable Resilience. Its Weight stat is notably high for this stage, giving it enough strength to handle heavier catches while keeping reel stability consistent.

+7% chance for Sparkling (1.85×)

training-rod.description:
The Training Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod obtained in Moosewood for C$300.

Handy fishing rod for honing your fishing skills. Remember, stay calm.
The Training Rod is a Stage 1 Fishing Rod with low overall stats and a focus on stability and control.
